block.p: Re ''Confusion Is Rife About Drug Plan as Sign-Up Nears'' (front page, Nov. 13):
Re ''Confusion Is Rife About Drug Plan as Sign-Up Nears'' (front page, Nov. 13):
I am geriatrician, and the majority of my practice will be affected by the new Medicare drug benefit.

I recently attended a briefing for physicians about the benefit and could hardly believe how confusing it is. I thought that it was unlikely any practicing physicians played a major role in formulating this program.
Right now, doctors do not get reimbursed for much of the work that goes into the care of older adults. Telephones calls, e-mail messages and paperwork are not tasks for which we can bill Medicare.
The new drug benefit will likely add many more hours of nonreimbursable work for doctors who will have to navigate through dozens of formularies.
A simpler system would have been much more beneficial to the most important people involved: patients and physicians.
Perhaps this will convince the medical community that we must play a more active role in health policy and legislation.
Tara Fernando Bishop, M.D. New York, Nov. 13, 2005
